Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Bokke333
Reviews.Content: Superb PR from a very kind and helpful lady at the Hotel Stella who help me out of a tricky situation allowing use of their internet access to sort our an urgent flight problem. I was staying at the Hotel Andreotti who didn't have a working public internet access and weren't much interested in my problem or prepared to help, luckily their very kind and friendly neighbours were more helpful. Thanks again to Hotel Stella for saving the day, they will definitely be on my list for the next Rome trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: hellij
Reviews.Content: Good base for exploring. Good shower, comfortable beds, clean - safe in our room did not work (key lock replaced with brass knob). Close to termini, supermarket and good value restaurants. Noise an issue on first night - tvs turned up too loud; families talking loudly late into night. Other than that, simple breakfast in small space but fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Blankaon
Reviews.Content: Stella is one of hundreds hotels around Termini.Fortunately, it is only 5 minutes walk and located in quiet street. Room is tiny but clean, breakfast - one roll and one croassant per person + unlimited jam, butter, cheese, cornflakes, juice... You do not need public transport, it is easy to walk to the city centre. Supermarket is just around corner (Conad), reasonable restaurants as well - we liked La Famiglia.

Reviews.Title: “Web site "Guarantee" is Meaningless!”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborMHT
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the previous comments regarding the Hotel Stella, thus will not repeat them. My review centers on the booking process, Hotel Stella’s web site and their “Best Rate Guarantee.” I usually try to book via hotel web sites for budget hotels, recognizing that it’s better for a budget hotel, not to have to pay a commission to booking engines. Because Hotel Stella also offered a “Best Rate Guarantee” I made my reservation with confidence. Misguided! I made a reservation for 3 nights, the first night I accepted a triple room because a single was not available; the other two nights I booked a single room. On their reservation page I requested a single room for the first night, should one become available. Later I checked Booking.com and found that they offered a single room for all three nights and at a lower rate then Hotel Stella’s web site. When I checked in I asked the receptionist about the “Best Rate Guarantee” and he told me that it only applied to reservations made by telephone, although this is not indicated on their web site. He also said that they must pay their web site money for each booking, thus the reason why it only applies to telephone reservations. I asked if they had changed my booking as requested to a single room on the first night, but they had not, even though a room had become available, but was no longer available upon my arrival. When I checked out I asked Rodice, the receptionist, again about the Best Rate Guarantee and what it means. She couldn’t tell me and basically said that other published rates might be better, but there is no recourse. I asked if they would adjust the rate of my triple room to a single room and she refused. Thus I would not recommend booking via their web site, until you check out a few booking engines. The triple room I had for the first night was on the 6th floor, which looked entirely different from the hotel, giving me the impression that they were private apartments. There are no numbers on the doors and I had to return to reception to find out which room I was in and request assistance opening the door because there are two sets of locks and one key. Both the triple room and the single room were very clean. The single room bed was very uncomfortable. The “rich continental breakfast” does not have cold cuts as advertised on their web site and the cheese is processed cheese in individual wrappers. Not the best breakfast especially if you are staying a few days, but certainly not the worst I have had either! The internet site pictures of the rooms seem professional staged and don’t reflect the current status of the rooms, which isn’t bad, just a bit more “used” looking. The current picture showing a brown sofa tucked in the left hand corner, lots of glass windows and a vast reception area IS NOT the Hotel Stella. Free internet available, good secure storage and a bathroom for use after checkout. Overall the rooms are functional and very clean; my main disappointment was in the booking process, honesty and lack of costumer care by reception. There is definitely room for improvement!

Reviews.Title: “Words to the wise...”
Reviews.Author: andybest82
Reviews.Content: Most of the things, one is to expect from a 3 star hotel. They therefore did not influence my rating. Others one does not always expect which can be either good or bad. These did influence my rating. I start by saying I would recommend this place if you want a little bit more "leisure" then you would expect from a 3 start hotel but mainly use the hotel to sleep in, because your aim is to work, or travel around Rome all day, like I did. The positives; - cheap price - location well connected by Metro (Termini - line A and B, Costro Pretorio - line B, Republica - line A). Nevertheless, beware of Termini after 7pm - some rather dodgy characters turn up. You should be fine if in a group and/or highly aware of your surroundings. _ exceptionally clean place. Bathroom always cleaned spotless and bed always tidied wrinkeless. Except the last night where the room smelled slightly like the maid had eaten a tuna sandwich. I would not recommend the place to a germophobe due to the fitted carpet which though vacuumed is definitely not going to be dust and germ free. - tv with good (non-crap) channels - as long as you understand Italian. I barely stayed at the hotel but sleeping to a good film on a nice 32 inch flat screen was a nice touch. - personnel was helpful. Any question I had, they answered properly. - after check out you can leave luggage in a safe place until it's time for you to leave - the free internet point, recently installed, is definitely a value added. The internet point is really just an internet enabled PC. The PC was more tired than I was after 5 days of non-stop walking, but just for the fact a PC was even available this point does not effect my rating. The personnel were also kind enough to allow me to print all the the tickets I had bought online at no extra cost. The negatives; - breakfast was very limited as one would expect from a 3 star hotel. However I have been in a 2.5 star hotel in prague with a LOT more choice and quality of food. - late check out not allowed - Despite being helpful, personnel were arguably not that friendly - it's hard to see a smile even if you make them smile. I was told this is common place in Rome however I found many places (restaurants, etc) with a better attitude towards the customer. - the hotel itself does not have a restaurant. for me this was not a big issue because I would rather eat all round Rome. If you need a restaurant close by, this is not a problem as the surroundings are littered with restaurants, osterias and bars. However quality is pretty low or/and expensive, with only a few exceptions. - the worst thing about the hotel (but not sure if this is common to most of Rome - many forums seems to hint at this) is the noise. No double glazed glass, no sound insulation in the walls and ceilings/floors. You can hear people walking by your door (unless it's just because all the heavily obese and hyper people came out to party in the corridors between 11pm and 9 am), TVs, maids, people in the room above moving furnature every night (possibly in preparation for the hyper-obese party?), people going down the stairs, and finally drilling and other works going on within the shaft which my room window overlooked

Reviews.Title: “Rome in a weekend”
Reviews.Author: Sam H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my girlfriend from 9-12 December 2011. In bullet point format: -Room is basic but perfectly adequate. We had no complaints. -Breakfast. Continental. It is small compared to a fry up that's for sure but after the initial shock of not having a 5* hot breakfast the atmosphere has a relaxed ambiance about it....something we appreciated in Rome the more we stayed. Its a roll each, croissant each, tea, coffee, and that funny choice of pomegranate or purple juice! Comes with spreadable cheese, jam, honey all in mini packets, that sort of thing. I grew to like this as the start to the day. -Location. Fantastic. Right near the Termini station. From here you can get the metro (two simple lines, A and B so easy to follow), bus, coach, open top tours. Makes life easy if you are there to explore, which we most definitely did. Other tips: -Airport to hotel. If you arrive anytime between 5am and 11pm you will find it easy to get from the airport to the Roma Termini. Bus, coach (simplest and £4-£6), taxi (£50 but share as we did and this drops). Be prepared to be rushed by taxis when you leave, just be patient, calm and make a choice if you prefer taxi for comfort, or coach for cost. If you arrive, as we did, after 11pm, signs may say a coach is available to 1am or later but they are not easy to find. So we found another couple, and shared a taxi with them. A lot of people head towards the Roma Termini, get here and your hotel is moments away. Rome- You can not fully explore the ins and outs of Rome in 3 days but it was just right for us. You will easily cover the main tourist sights with a little time to check out the not so common places. Roma Pass - we got one and it saved hassle more than anything. It gets you on all transport (but not to airport) so just on a bus, or the metro or tram and its free. Cost wise, we broke about even and it does save a queue into the Colosseo. You get free entry into two attractions plus discounts thereon, as least try to use the two free ones (Colosseo being one). Cost - Its not that expensive. Food is reasonable, drinks..especially wine, is £5-£7 for .5 litre of house wine. Not forgetting that's 2/3rds of a bottle and considering that comes with a view of the Colosseo or Pantheon, it's very reasonable. If you want expensive try Brussels where a beer in central areas is £5+ a half pint (standard measure). Food, we never paid more than £50 / euro (rate pretty much even) and that included wine and a nice meal. We planned on £100 each a day but came back with plenty of change. Vatican - We paid for one of the many tours on offer. It gets you in without queuing which is vital, if you are there for 3 days you have not got the time to queue. We paid £40/euro each which included the £25 of entry fees. Nice to have someone explaining what it is you are looking at and it lasted over 3 hours. Don’t miss the Pope at mid-day Sundays, all in Italian but very good experience. Borghese - Book it. Cant be booked Sundays (although open), closed Mondays. This was our only mistake as we missed what we think would have been a good part of the break. The hotel will book for you. Language: Learn just the most basic of words to get a good response from staff at the hotel / restaurants. Bonjourno, Arividerchi, Chow (spelling…???) is enough, it really helps. Other reviews: Try to take some of the reviews with a pinch of salt. Some of the negatives (like breakfast) easily become positives with a positive frame of mind. Have a great time :)

Reviews.Title: “visit to Rome 3rd to 6th November 2011”
Reviews.Author: blossomtoes
Reviews.Content: great location, basic hotel. 17 in our group and we enjoyed our stay. only down side there is no residents lounge but the hotel next door had one and a bar and did not mind us being there. plenty of eateries in the local area, good food not overpriced. had a great visit. bin lorries are noisy early morning but just turn over and go back to sleep. supermarket round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but good”
Reviews.Author: BravoLima7
Reviews.Content: + It's a basic, but comfortable hotel. The room was clean and it wasn't small at all. Bathroom is also OK. The hotel is located in a quiet and safe neighborhood. - The walls are extremely thin, a noisy neighbor can be a nightmare. Breakfast is the same every day.

Reviews.Title: “Stay to forget”
Reviews.Author: Miguel T
Reviews.Content: For all the hotels I stayed in Europe this has been the worst. The service is appalling, breakfast is the same always, the rooms are very small, the towels are of poor quality and require you to pay in cash. During my stay also the electric power went down 30 minutes into the building and the elevator is very old and not always work.

Reviews.Title: “AKA the hotel of horrors”
Reviews.Author: clairefollowsthevw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Stella for 2 nights and quite frankly that's enough! Upon entering the hotel you're greeted with a dark and dingy interior with a cage lift to take you up to your needed floor ... hence the name we affectionaly gave the hotel. The fact that there was also a dentist on the 1st floor of this hotel also made this place to stay slightly strange. The staff in reception were rude and unhelpful except for the young signore who was on shift at night. The rooms are basic and I mean basic. The bed was rock hard with one pillow each and holes and rips in the bedding. The brown scratchy blanket did nothing for our romantic weekend away. You had to climb into the sink or shower to be able to shut the bathroom door and towels consisted of very large teatowels (very strange). There were no tea making facilities or wi-fi and the keyboard on the old computer didn't work when trying to access the internet. Breakfast consisted of 1 roll and 1 croissant per guest but was complimented by a lovely breakfast lady who was at least smiley compared to the other staff. At 7 am machinery started as builders set to work next door. This was not mentioned at anytime during our booking. The hotel also had a powercut for half hour and although plunged into darkness there was no assistance or explanation. When we booked the hotel we were advised it was a 3* but it's not and actually we think it just about scrapped the 2*'s it's actually been rated. Definitely not worth £110 a night. The best thing about this hotel was the location, great being so close to the Termini and actually within walking distance to most of the sights.

Reviews.Title: “worst nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne C
Reviews.Content: unhelpful and rude staff. lift is a death trap. uncomfortable bed. jackhammer started at 7am very poor breakfast although the lady serving it was the only thing i liked about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Capreborn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so bad it nearly ended my relationship! No wifi in it's place was a old computer only one in the hotel would like to know why the building work started at 7 am and the towels were like large bad tea towels the room was tiny and for the price you don't even get a double bed only two singles put together and the cover was like sleeping in a curtain very scratchy but the breakfast lady was lovely

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in a lift and the person on reception was quite rude”
Reviews.Author: SGormley
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed in this hotel in Rome. They had a room on the fifth floor. The hotel is basic but clean and a good location. All was fine until my parents used the lift one day along with another man. The lift made some terrible noises and then ground to a halt between floors 4 and 5. The man in the lift called reception to get help. While my parents were stuck in the very hot lift the receptionist told them they were 'too big' and there should be only two people in the lift but the sign in the lift said it could take 3 people. Maybe a working load sign would have been more appropriate for the lift. Eventually, the lift was hand cranked back to the ground floor and they got out. No one from the hotel checked that they were ok, the receptionist was only interested in the other man in the lift - my parents were totally ignored. They were both quite upset. They wouldn't go back to the Hotel Stella.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Edmonton999
Reviews.Content: Nice location, comfortable bed and very clean. Good value for the money. Noisy in the day because of construction next door - bring ear-plugs if you plan to sleep in the day.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: Mariel S
Reviews.Content: [+] A few blocks from Termini Station, generally in a safe area, friendly and helpful staff, adequate and satisfying breakfast (breads, cereals) [-] No wifi (but free use of computer at the lobby for up to an hour daily), can get noisy at night Traveling with family, stayed in a triple room. Clean, spacious and with a high ceiling (a nice surprise for us) It has 2 windows and a bathroom. The room itself was quaint, with a fridge and a small tv and an AC. The AC, however, did not appear to function properly (it was still a bit hot at night). We could not leave the windows open as it becomes very noisy at the middle of the night (often times I get awakened by the noise, not sure if it was garbage trucks or what). The beds were okay. We stayed there for 5 nights, and if you are staying longer, you might find the breakfast repetitive. We however enjoyed it and found it quite satisfying. If you're looking for variety, there are tons of restaurants and other places to eat nearby. The area felt safe and we were able to walk to and from the station without worrying much about the homeless / drunks. If ever we come back to Rome, we might consider staying on another hotel (maybe somewhere away from the city noise this time). But overall we had a pleasant stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and adequate but too hot with no aircon for August”
Reviews.Author: Alwaystravelling90
Reviews.Content: Positives: Room was very clean, bed was made and towels changed daily, Breakfast was good- cereal, rolls and italian style croissants with spreads, tea, coffee (not hot food which you wouldn't expect really) Negatives: Room and bathroom was very small but this wasn't a big deal for us as we weren't in Rome to stay in the hotel room for ages! Main downside was that there was NO AC- which is August made it quite unbearable, there was a fan which helped but we could only cool down by having cold showers Staff were quite standoff-ish but that wasn't a big deal really and they did seem to cheer up when we checked out so maybe they aren't always like that. Location: 5-10 mins walk from Termini station (seems longer the first time you do it but its really pretty close) where you can get the metro to quite a few tourist spots in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Can see why there are good and bad reviews about this hotel. Noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: SW40
Reviews.Content: Staff are ok, they come across as a bit cold at first but when you make the effort to speak to them they become much friendlier. Stayed for 2 nights, the first night I barely slept at all as the noise from inside and outside the hotel was awful. We were near the cranky lift and the breakfast room but the doors throughout the hotel were slamming until about 3am which ricochet though the building. The walls are paper thin and you can clearly hear when adjacent rooms are going to the loo, have the hairdryer on and chatting. The outside noise was continuous until about 2am - mopeds, people, binmen, street cleaners, glass recycling at 1am! I was ready to check out and find somewhere else. However we asked if we could move rooms and the staff were helpful and moved us from the 2nd floor up to the 5th floor. The window this time had upvc windows which were brilliant at blocking out noise and not being near the lift and breakfast room was a vast improvement. Rooms were clean but tiny and did have a pube in the bed both nights! The location was good for being near buses, trains and metros for exploring Rome. A few drunks, homeless people and a transvestite prostitute about but didn't ever feel unsafe. I would prefer to stay in another region of Rome I think

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel with very unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WorkingAnts
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly staff at the reception; you don't feel yourself at home at all. The room was overall satisfying though it was very small and you could hear everything from the nearby rooms. The hotel is near the tram station "Castro Pretorio" and Stazione Termini and all major sightseeings. The supermarket located not far away from the hotel was very handy. The staff and the service could definitely improve

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimico14
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located a few blocks from Termini Station. Was not sure if the proximity to Termini would be an issue but was pleasantly surprised to find it was in a good (safe) neighbourhood with lots of pedestrian traffic and restaurants close by. No WiFi but they did provide a computer near the lobby for guest use.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value choice for visiting Rome attractions”
Reviews.Author: MontrealSoxFan
Reviews.Content: Very good value for Rome if looking for a centrally located, clean & comfortable place to sleep in Rome. 15-20 minute walk or short taxi ride to most attractions. Modern, updated and clean rooms, very good air conditioning, but small bathrooms (no bathtub, tiny shower). Little in the way of hotel services, so you wouldn't be happy with this hotel if you like ordering room service or sitting by a pool, and the included breakfast is minimal "continental". Quiet location with some good restaurants and coffee shops nearby. Be advised that room noise is a bit on the loud side when guests and staff start moving around in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a cheap stay”
Reviews.Author: Aroundin80Days154976
Reviews.Content: As a student travelling in Europe my funds were not great but this hotel fit the budget and was well above our standards. Did not spend much time in the actual hotel, just a place to sleep for two nights on our trip. Sleep well was very quiet and clean. Great for anyone on a budget as well it had the most AMAZING view!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, clean room that was serviced daily.”
Reviews.Author: Halide69
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and although we couldn't check in early we left our bags in the lobby area. The staff were helpful and our room was clean and functional. Their is only a very small old lift that can only take 2 people but we needed to walk up the stairs to burn off all the amazing food! We had an amazing time and would not hesitate to come back to this hotel or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whoyou222
Reviews.Content: I had no problems with this hotel. I stayed for 4 nights and the hotel staff was helpful. The room was clean. The walls were thin I could hear pretty good the noise in the hotel. There was no noise outside because the hotel is not on a main drag or highly populated area. I would use again. Hotel price was great for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff for a Valentines suprise”
Reviews.Author: jackwebdale
Reviews.Content: I should say I did not stay at this hotel, but the staff were immensely helpful in helping me surprise my girlfriend who stayed here on Valentines day (Feb 14th). The staff of Hotel Stella made sure that a rose and a Valentines card were ready on her bed when she arrived, and the communication and their willingness to help me make it happen was amazing. All within a 4 day period with me mailing the card from London. They were even so kind as to e-mail me a photo for my approval to make sure I was happy with the layout (!). All this was at only a £15 euro cost for the rose. As for the room, my partner commented that she enjoyed her stay, and that the room were very clean and comfortable, and the staff very friendly. But I would say that a place that have such helpful staff that will put in extra effort for special requests like this is certainly a place I would like to stay. Special thanks to Livia and Jana, you guys are stars! :) Jack

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanBZ
Reviews.Content: Five days in this hotel at the beginning of november were really pleasant. Very good location to the metro (Termini or Castro Pretorio) or bus (Piazza Indipendenza), staff spoke very good english and were very polite. The triple room was big enough with minifridge and LCD tv and very quite (5-th floor) A minus -the WC not flush correct (need to push several times) A plus – the old elevator. A very plus for the the cleaning staff. Never felt unsafe in the area even at latenight with a 9 y.o. child. Overall, nice hotel, beautiful Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than a Hostel - Not recommended for more than one night”
Reviews.Author: pdxd
Reviews.Content: LOCATION Agree with the other reviewers about the location, very close to Termini, but at the same time there were about 50 other better hotels in that one dense area too. We had booked 4 nights at this hotel originally and had to change after one night. SERVICE When we arrived, the friendly hotel staff gave us a key on a one pound keychain for room 307 and gave us directions. The keychain was very dense. They also didn't even give us a city map, we had to ask for it. All the other hotels in Italy provided that and explained all the directions to the major sites clearly. ELEVATOR We were on the third floor so had to take our luggage in the little elevator slated for 2 people. You had to close the cage with a door that had a staplegun for a handle (well, it looked like it) THE ROOM The room was pretty spacious however that was as good as it got. The view from our window looked out into the back alley where there were dumpsters. The room did not come with any amenities for hot water for tea/coffee. We ignored that, as some places don't provide that anyways, and we understood it was 2 star. At one point we came back to the room and it smelled of cigarette smoke. Hopefully coming from outside but we weren't sure as it seemed to be locallized to our room. At night it was quiet but in the morning you could clearly hear the echo of people as the breakfast room was directly below us. WASHROOM The washroom was terrible. They gave us J-cloth towels to use but it was mostly thrown on the floor as the shower kept leaking the entire time. We had brought small ones from home to use instead just in case of this.. The sliding doors on the shower would not close properly and I think there was mildew on the bottom edge of the doors. Their shower head connected directly to the wall, so there was no snake tube thing to make it easy to direct the flow of water. The hot water took forever to come on and when it did, it was limited. WATER My fiance went downstairs to ask for a bottle of water (usually they have a vending machine or room service or something). Apparently the reception man just pulled out 2 bottles from his personal rucksack and we paid 2euro for them. They were the first warm bottles of water we've ever purchased in all of our Greece/Italy trip. BREAKFAST We decided to give this hotel one more chance and at least see what the breakfast was like in the morning. We went downstairs to the 2nd floor following the murmur sound of people. The "buffet" was one of condiments and cereal. They gave everyone each one chunk of bread and a wrapped sweetbread that smelled like chemicals when you opened it. The cereal was served with warm milk. That was our last straw. INTERNET This hotel does not have WIFI. They give you an old computer from the 90s that each guest has a limit of 1 free hour a day to use. We used our one hour that next morning to look up other hotels on trip advisor in this area. Finding no bookings available we decided to just walk around and see what the reception desks all say. RELOCATING I fully recommend during the off season like this month to come without hotel reservations. It was worth our while to walk around from hotel to hotel asking for prices. We finally settled on a good one called Astoria Garden, down the street and checked out before Stella could charge us for another night. They gave us a great room, great price with all amenities, and threw in WIFI and it was 3 star which happened to be less expensive than Stella's 2 star. SUMMARY Fairly clean, but we won't come back because of all the reasons stated above, and we aren't picky people. We had even just stayed at a hostel in Venice that was 10-times better than this badly managed hole.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place that is good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: SammiVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hotel Stella. The rooms were clean. We had a double, which was very small and the bathroom had no vanity. We were on the 3rd floor. It took a very long time for the water in the shower to get hot. But once it did the shower was fine. Very reasonablly priced. We loved the fact that it was within walking distance of Termini. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stella - The star that does not shine”
Reviews.Author: malta
Reviews.Content: We stay in Hotel Stella in a double room for one night. The bed was one of the smallest I have ever seen, (was more like a good sized single bed!). The room was small but clean but the sheets and the towels had a funny detergent smell. There was no hot water in our room and when we called reception she told us to wait cause it might have been that everyone must have washed at the same time. We ended up not having a shower since we were running late. The common area was practically a small sized reception room and an old small lft that took ages to arrive. The cherry on the cake was that the taxi driver told us that the receptionist did not want to inform us that he was waiting for us since he arrived a few minutes before. One must also note that they also asked us to pay on arrival even though we had not even seen our room. The only postive note was the location since it is around 10mins walk from Termini station, not the best area but convenient and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: stevew918
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient for budget minded tourists, as it is only 5 minutes walk to the Rome main train station and the two main subway lines. The receptionlist staff was very friendly, professional, efficient and spoke very good English. The room was good size, quiet, clean but the furniture was getting tired somewhat. I got a great price through this Trip Advisor site; so I This is a great value deal. Two items of concern for some special customers (1) If you are hard walking steps, you may want to reconsider as you will need to walk about 10 steps up to the reception level, and the hotel elevator is kind of old and slow. If it breaks down, you may have a hard time getting to your room. (2) If you are BIG and round, you may want to reconsider. The shower stall was very very small, similar or even smaller than those on cruise ship ( see photo). I am a small asian and had to sqeeze in and out of the opening. There maybe room with bigger shower stalls, but it may be worthwhile for you to be aware before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: LondonSBSurrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in their quadruple room for 6 nights. It was simply the best that we could have asked for our week long holiday in Rome. The room was very clean. The bathroom was spotless. Room cleaned everyday with new towels (bath, face and hand towels for all 4 guests). We found the staff at the reception desk very friendly, spoke English and very helpful with all the queries we had. There is a free computer with broadband available 24 hours at the lobby which was very useful to transfer photos and browse the net. Even though the check-in time is 13:30, when we arrived at the hotel at 11:00am, the room was ready and we were allowed to go straight into our room. Even if the room wasn't available there was an option to leave the luggage with the hotel. After checking out on the last day, we were allowed to leave the luggage with the hotel and that made the last day of the holiday more enjoyable as we didn't have to worry about dragging the luggage all the way to the Termini station. Termini station is just around the corner. So easy to get back to the hotel, especially when tired after a full morning of site seeing to have a rest before starting the evening schedule. There is a supermarket CONARD around the corner (at Piazza Independenza) which is less than a minute's walk from the hotel. There is a taxi stand at this place which is so convenient to get back to the airport with the luggage. Barberni, Spanish steps all within 15-20 minutes walk from the hotel (via XX Setembre). Hotel breakfast is adequate if not extensive. It was more than enough for us to fill the stomach before venturing into Rome. If you are after big cooked breakfast then this may not be the place for you. Breakfast included orange and grapefruit juices, milk, two cereal varieties, coffee, tea, packed rusk, honey, chocolate and fruit jam spreads. All these are unlimited. In addition to that each person is served with a packed croissant and a bun/roll . Altogether it was a relaxing stay at Hotel Stella!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Option for Budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: SR1990
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Stella for two nights and got the room pretty last minute and only paid 80 euros, which I thought was a pretty good deal, considering how late I got it. The staff was pretty nice and helpful and spoke English. They pointed me to the nearest metro station and located the major sights for me on the map. Also, it's great the hotel is a few blocks to Termini, which is where the train goes that leaves from Fiumicino Airport to travel into the center of Rome. The room was pretty small, but I think it was a standard size for European hotel rooms. There was a TV in the room, although I couldn't find any English channels. Unfortunately, the hotel did not have any WiFi, which would have been useful to look up directions in Rome. Another great thing about the hotel was the complimentary breakfast. It's not much, so if you're the type of person who needs to eat a lot for breakfast, it probably won't fill you up. But it was decent and a great way to save money. Overall, I liked the hotel and I would recommend it to someone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but perfectly OK.”
Reviews.Author: Jobie
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a group of friends and had a great time in Rome. The hotel is a basic 2 star hotel, with few refinements but doing the essential things well. First, on the less-good side, the entrance is just a door, the hotel reception is very small, and the rooms are basic. There are no public rooms except the breakfast room. Furniture brown, and my single room was quite small, doubles looked better. But it had the essentials, and if coming to visit Rome, who wants to spend time swinging cats in a hotel room....?? On the 'good' side, the rooms are very well cleaned, and all towels changed every day (these are the napkin type towels, not big and fluffy.. but they work very well!). No smell of smoke, excellent (small) shower, TV worked fine, no noise from outside, area seems quiet, and breakfast perfectly acceptable (2 breads, cereal, fruit juices, jams, cheese, decent coffee) in a pleasant room. The location is very convenient - a few minutes walk from Termini for trains coming from airport, close to a main bus interchange there, and also to 2 Metro stations . Travelling in Rome is very cheap -1Euro per journey by any mode and however long, so you can travel right across Rome by Metro for just 1 euro! The hotel staff were fine for us - helpful when needed - they had our bookings correct and helped order 2 minibuses to get us all back to the airport. There is a good little restaurant outside - turn right leaving the hotel and its on the opposite side about 150 metres away, very friendly, good food, and very good value. Also several more up to the left. We found eating out cost probably much the same as UK on balance (and food often better quality), but if you eat or drink in the main tourist spots then there you will PAY - eg. 8 Euros for a beer outside the Pantheon!! In such places, also look carefully at your bill to check it is correct. Overall, a very nice little hotel, with some character, and in a good location. If you want modern rooms with all the bits and pieces that you might find in a 4* on the Med, then look elsewhere. This is good value and we loved it. PS. If you are over 65, then entry to all attractions is free -- this makes travelling round and then visiting the wonderful "sights" amazingly cheap!! But they do get crowded.... go early if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Hotel at a Below Average Price”
Reviews.Author: taryn615
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was very pleased with my stay at Hotel Stella in Rome! The location can't be beat -- just a few blocks away from the main train station (5-10 minute walk with luggage) but far enough away that it doesn't feel like you're staying near a major station. The rooms were spotlessly clean and rather spacious by European standards. The bed was a bit hard, but there were extra pillows and blankets in the room. A nice touch! Our room was quiet. No street noises or disturbances from other guests. Contrary to other reviews, we were pleased with breakfast. Unlimited cereal, jams and coffee with a basket of bread. We left full every morning. My only complaint is the restaurant (La Famiglia) that was reccomended to us by the front desk staff on our first night there. It was awful, overpriced and a complete tourist trap. For a much better, authentic Italian meal, check out Giovanni's, just 4 blocks away off of Via 20 Settembre.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Oots
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Stella is a terrible place to stay. I have travelled a lot and like to think I am open-minded. However, I really feel the owners don't deserve to have customers. This is for the following reasons: - I tried to have a shower at different times of day and always the water was cold (and this was in mid January!) - The room was cold and I had to sleep in several layers. - The TV didn't work and kept switching itself off after 2 minutes. - I was kept awake until 1am two nights running because of parties in rooms nextdoor - the walls are extremely thin. - There was only just enough loo roll. - Very limited breakfast (no fruit or yoghurt) and poor coffee. - The room smelled of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: terryRugby
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Stella overall the hotel was in an excellent position near to the Metro, Hop on/off buses and Termini station.Breakfast was basic one roll and one croissant.Rooms were basic but very clean.No amenities for ironing,no irons in hotel at all, not all rooms have mini bars.The bar that other people have reviewed had been shut down.Make sure you book a double room with travel agent as will be given twin beds.(z beds).

Reviews.Title: “Total incompetance and rudeness!”
Reviews.Author: MikaelaB2
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 9.30pm as a single woman to be told that my booking was not made and I spent 45 minutes insisting that the hotel find me a room. I had paperwork to proove I had booked but they insisted I hadn't and were going to leave me to wander Rome to find a hotel. They were rude and inefficient for the duration of my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice And Clean Love Stella!!”
Reviews.Author: SILVINILS
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, spotless clean, refresh, bathroom was really clean and restored, the room 208 has a perfect view of palms and trees, not easy to find at Europe and in a small hotel. Excellent location in the correct side from Roma Termini Station, you can choose the Metro for all Major atractions, even you can walk. Nice and not expensive restaurants near the hotel, very safe place as I was traveling along, I walk at night and no problem , quiet. Special thanks to DIMITRI, very nice person who take care of my reservation as I was calling late at night from Madrid, he did everything to find a room for me. I would be back in my next visit to Rome. Don't agree with other reviews the hotel it's really nice and very very clean and spotless.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay there”
Reviews.Author: kitten159
Reviews.Content: hotel locks all doors after 11pm and we had to ring to get back in. the staff was extremely difficult and the brochure from were we booked our hotel did not tell us that the a/c was extra, they said it was included in their price. 2 tiny beds and so close together that it was difficult to sleep. no internet connection even thought it was requested and paid for. do not go there

Reviews.Title: “Worst breakfast in Rome - INSTANT COFFEE!”
Reviews.Author: dcolins
Reviews.Content: The WC in our room would not flush so we told reception. They said it DID work but needed pushing several times. As it was jammed there was no way it could be pressed anyway. As we still couldn't use it we asked for a different room but were told the hotel was full so that was impossible. We stood on the WC and reached up to the cistern to pull the valve inside it. Reception said it was NOT broken but difficult to use, lots of people had difficulty with it. My suggestion that they get it fixed was met with a shrug. The coffee at breakfast is instant - incredible in Rome and you get a basket dumped on your table with one roll and one croissant. We asked to use the internet to check in for our flights and were asked to return in 10 minutes. When we did, the receptionist said we must have turned the phone off in our room as she had tried to ring us to say she couldn't get a connecttion. We stayed at the Stella because I stayed there for one night last year,and there was exactly the same story with their computer then - the power "keeps cutting out." I suggested they get a maintenance man in to fix the WC and internet but it was as if I had been speaking Martian. There is a club underneath the hotel with loud music but this did not bother us. However, the people in the next room were having a party well after midnight so I rang reception but they said they could do nothing about it as they could not leave the desk.. We asked for an alarm call in the morning after checking that the phone ringer WAS turned on, but did not receive one. True, this hotel is only 10 minutes from the station (but in the wrong direction for ALL sights),, and it is only 100 Euros a night but when you add in the cost of a decent breakfast (or even just decent coffee) somewhere else, and the annoyance caused by the broken WC and their refusal to do anything about it, the the trek to an internet cafe and the noisy neighbours, it just isn't worth it. This is the first time I've complained about anywhere as you tend to think "Oh well, that's the way it is here," but they need to smarten up their act. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel was in an excellent location near termini”
Reviews.Author: foxy_lil_hairdresser
Reviews.Content: my friends and i all 60 years old stayed at this hotel it was only minutes from the termini where buses left for all the attractions. the hotel was very clean .after a hard day of sightseeing we had our dinner in nearby restaurants of which there were many.we all said we would go back to this hotel.staff were very nice .no safes in rooms but we were able to leave valuables in the hotel safe free of charge also our room had a fridge great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KentLucy21
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Hotel Stella, simple but clean room with a good shower. Was very cold in the room especially at night, have to ask for the controls for the heating and then they are tempremental! Very good location to the station and historic attractions, staff spoke very good english and were very polite and accomodating. Breakfast was fine (croissant and a roll), bit of a shock if you are used to full english breakfasts in britain! Overall a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great sleep”
Reviews.Author: kiwinz_7
Reviews.Content: Stopover in Rome Had wonderful room with loads of space for 4 guests kids were accommodated on pullout couch with 2 indivdual beds - no fights!! good walking distance from the termini with some good little restaurants nearby breakfast in morning was good cereal and dry toast and croissants and jam.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, don't know if I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: BaselLisa
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed in a couple of nearby hotels on previous trips to Rome and had seen a good review in a guide, so thought we'd give it a go this time. The location is good, just 5 minutes walk from Termini train station. There's a supermarket just down the road if you're wanting to get supplies for picnics or whatever. The check-in was the slowest I've ever seen. The woman on reception was so thorough with our passports that I could have sworn she was a customs official. Honestly, check-in took a lonnnnggg time. The room was pleasant enough, smallish, but hot in July. I think you had to pay extra for airconditioning. But hey, it was 80 euros and Rome is not a cheap place to stay. The breakfast was lousy. I've wiped in from my memory already. Okay, but would I go there again? Hmm, not sure.

Reviews.Title: “only one night.....”
Reviews.Author: winkmiester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last night of our honeymoon in room, becasue it was a short walk from the train station. It was small, clean, and satisfactory. Recpetion staff was okay, a little cold. Were pretty sure she hates her job. There is a small lift to take you up stairs. Breakfast was ok, the usual cold continiental. This hotel is located overtop of a bar, and it depends where you are in the hotel, that affects your sleep. We didnt make out too bad, but we could hear the remnants of 100 italians singing YMCA until 2 am in the morning. So if you have small children, or are old, and need some heavy duty beauty sleep, save your coin. The only other issue i had was thier towels. Picture a regular tea towel that would use for your dishes, but make it the same size as a bath towel, and thats it. It leaves alot to be desired......

Reviews.Title: “Good luck getting any sleep”
Reviews.Author: ECUnited
Reviews.Content: We ended up here, only because we got bumped from another hotel, due to another guest's family medical emergency. The room was clean, and the en-suite bath was nice, but A/C was an extra charge, which our original hotel did not request, so we were forced to open the windows. There was a restaurant/bar on the street right below our window and there was constant noise until after 2 am. In addition, the street noise was horrible. Got next to no sleep the entire night. The receptionist was NOT friendly at all and seemed quite put out that we had been sent to them by the other hotel. Would only stay here again if I got bumped again, or it was the only place available, but it would definitely NOT be in my top ten choices of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a few nights, but will not return”
Reviews.Author: Nhasand
Reviews.Content: The better parts: - the room was clean, clean, clean. - the situation was good, about 10 minutes of slowly walking from the Termini train station. - the window was sound proof. When closing, you hardly heard the noise from the street below. - the bar mentioned somewhere in older reviews, was out of business when we where there, so it was no noice from there :) The not-so-good parts: - if you spook English to the staff at the reception, you got only a kind of cold shoulder regarding their responds to you. They gave me short-short sentences, without any polite phrases like "please" or "welcome"... this regards espescially one lady. I tried to be polite and gave her smiles, but she was almost stone cold! The two other ladies at the reception were in some better mood. - The room we got was in the corner of 3rd floor. The sheet covering the bed was smelling smoke. We could hear the noice in the hallway and from other rooms. - It was no ventilation in the room. When keep the window closed, you could imaging how it felt :) As expected: - the breakfast was pure continental. dont expect any kind of buffe with eggs and bacon. - the cleaning staff was so polite and nice. The reception staff should learn from them. We paid EUR 120 per night from 31th March to 3rd. April. If getting back to Rome, we will try other hotel for a change. If we even come back to Rome then. But that is an other story.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accom. for a few days”
Reviews.Author: Jon1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in march, and I cannot complain! To be honest I paid peanuts to stay here, and the value for money was absolutely spot on, I only paid £32 per night! The reception staff are fine, if you attempt to speak Italian to them, and if you do a smile will follow! Ok the breakfast is not great, the coffee was disgusting, but the bread rolls and pastries were very good. As for the noise? I didn't hear a peep out of anyone or hear anything at all over 2 nights! This hotel is great if you want to dump your bags and explore Rome (like I did... definitely recommend the pantheon!). If you're looking for a romantic break then obviously you'd choose something more plush, instead of a basic hotel! Overall, I thought this hotel has very good for what I paid!

Reviews.Title: “not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: poussinFrance
Reviews.Content: this hotel is terrible. we arrived at 11pm, the window of the bedroom was open. when i tried to put the heat on, the hotel manager said that the heat is cut between 11:00 pm and 6AM. we have been freezing for the 2 days. it is also very noisy-do not expect to get any sleep afetr 6:30AM in addition, the reception staff is not very helpful, you have the feeling that you are disturbing them. not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep at Stella Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreenstoneGirl
Reviews.Content: We picked Hotel Stella because it said it was on a quiet steet and near the Termini Station. Big Mistake!!! The street is quiet until 100 university kids show up to the Bar directly below the hotel windows and start singing German beer songs out on the steet., while heavy metal band plays inside. The noise was deafening!. the bass was so loud that even in the windowless bathroom whie I was taking a shower with the fan going, I could feel and hear the bass vibrating. We had a 6 am wake up and so got no sleep as the bar didnt close until 2 am. I have some sympathy for the Stella hotel management as in other respects its a nice place with clean rooms and modern bathrooms, and the staff is helpful. But I feel they represented their hotel, they should have said its a good place for poeple who like to be near bars and restaurants as there are both on the steet. There were many complaints to the hotel staff that night, not just from us, and basically all were told there was nothing he could do. I cant recommend it to anyone needing a good nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: bernie012
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel we stayed here for 7 nights, big mistake i think that this hotel is better of you are only in Rome for 3-5 days. The breakfast is o.k for the first couple of days but you end up getting tired of the same thing Museli,Croissants,bread rolls and cornflakes. The staff are really helpful and generally nice people the room is clean but very basic the only English speaking tv station is MTV and make sure you pack some ear plugs if you are a light sleeper as the bar next door can be noisey or if you want you can pay 10 Euro and have the air conditioning on and close the window. The hotel is not in the best part of Rome but is close to the Termini and i can honestly say i didn't have a problem with the area. I would recommend this hotel for young couples wanting to holiday on a budget

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close to Termini central station, perfect for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: kaori_001
Reviews.Content: We booked a city trip to Roma in August and we were looking for an hotel in the centre more convenient for sightseeing but not to expensive. So we found Stella hotel on Internet. The localisation is very easy to find out, next to the Termini Central station. The room is small but clean and even if our room was just in front of the street, it was quiet and not noisy at all. We especially appreciated the silent c/o.The Staff is friendly but you cannot get a lot of prospectus of Roma from the hotel just a map with the main attractions (which was indeed very helpful). So for a City trip of 1-2 days, this hotel is perfect :)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a 2 star!!!!”
Reviews.Author: karching
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight in July. We did not book here but cause the hotel we did book overbooked themselves they put us here. From the outside I was thinking that the place was a dump. Then we had problems with the elevator and I was not looking foward to seeing the room.I was so suprised when seeing the room. It was large with a great big bathroom and the best shower I had in weeks. The air con worked really well also. The only downfall was that they did not have a safe in the room and their breakfast was really lame. Otherwise it was actually better than the three star hotel that we had booked. When going back to the hotel we booked, I wanted to go back to this hotel. If this hotel had a better breakfast and a safe then it should be classed a three star.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Turner
Reviews.Content: My friends booked this trip, and when I checked this site I thought "Oh my God", It prepared me to expect exactly what we got. The hotel is very clean, can't fault that, housekeeping were excellent, very polite, and nothing was too much trouble, we left them a generous tip. Reception wasn't frosty exactly, just a little chilly, although we only asked for our key from herself, the manager was much better, although a bit huffy when we asked for a cab to the airport. The sports bar below was noisey, thankfully it wasn't too hot, so we could close the windows and sleep. Some crowds of locals hang around the bar, and lurk about, smoking outside, chatting til late. Breakfast was ok, small breakfast room, perfectly clean and the service was friendly and quick. A basket of croissants and rolls, some sort of juice, tea and coffee, just what you'd expect on the continent, fine. Getting about was easy too. Turn right out of the hotel and walk into Piazza del Indepenza (sorry about spelling) the number 492 bus takes you into the city centre, using your map, you can nip on and off to most places, get your bus tickets before you ride, at the tabacci kiosk in the square, 1 euro for 1 trip, 4 for the day etc. Just a short walk further takes you to Termini Station, all the trains, buses and taxis you need are there. Quite rough at night around there though, becareful. Turn left and just around the corner is the restaurant, Africa, an excellent place to eat, open from Tuesday onwards. Overall, we had a great time, apart from the pickpocket on a very crowded bus, and the taxi strike, oh, and the Sistine Chapel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: PSLBKent
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4nights with my husband and 17month old daughter. When we arrived at the hotel the staff were very helpful at getting our room ready as quickly as possible (bearing in mind that it was 9am). The staff we found to be friendly, and they made a real fuss of our daughter, (most of the Italians seem to adore children)!! The hotel was clean and comfortable, and the breakfast was adequate. Also, the hotel was situated in a good location, very close to the main station (termini), and there is a supermarket and park near by. The only down side was that there is a bar beneth the hotel, which seemed a little noisy (especially on football nights)!! But a certain level of noise is to be expected anywhere in a large city. We didn't pay very much at all for our trip, and felt the hotel itself represented excellant value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel Stella”
Reviews.Author: father_of_a_boy
Reviews.Content: We liked it. Our family (2 adults + 16 month baby) even got a water heater to the room from the personnel. Personnel was kind and friendly. Room was clean and spacious, location of the hotel was great and close to Termini (7 minutes of walk with all the luggages). From Fiuminico this hotel is easy to reach by train. Supermarket is 2 minutes of walk from the hotel. Room was also quiet (5th floor).

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Becks8
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. Very clean and comfortable, 5 minutes walk from the airport bus drop off, and the Termini, in a quiet street. The continental breakfast was good, but the breakfast room was a little small. There is a nice bar below the hotel, which I can imagine would be noisey in the busier seasons. You can either walk to the main attractions from this hotel, or get on a 'hop on, hop off' bus.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems”
Reviews.Author: Maroulla
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, staff were friendly. We had a family room with bathroom which was spacious and tidy. Breakfast was continental- roll and a croissant, cereal and coffee. Located in good place to see everything if you don't mind walking took about 20 mins or so to spanish steps so everything is in walking distance. Area is not brilliant, bit scruffy in parts but not totally disgusting, didnt feel at risk or anything. Would stay there again because it was an impressive hotel for what we paid. No problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulthirtyeight
Reviews.Content: loved hotel stella clean bright wonderfull staff there were 16 of us ladys stayed here everyone said they would stay here again the rooms were large with lovely bathrooms frige and hair dryer clean bed linen and towels every day we could,nt have asked for more

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Stella”
Reviews.Author: Moville
Reviews.Content: My Friend and I were on our first visit to the beautiful city of Rome and our stay there was made special by the location of the hotel and the charming atmosphere of the place. Friendly staff, very clean, great location to termini but most of all walking distance to most of the beautiful architectural sights in the world. It is also very convenient to a great variety of resturants. The downside was it could be a bit noisy at night, as there is a Bar downstairs. But this can be overcome with closed windows, and as it was so hot we had air conditioning. The Hotel Stella is so reasonally priced we are going back next year. Can't wait

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff-Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our extended family stayed at the Stella in February 2005. The staff did everything possible for the 17 of us who were with several children after the Olympics. For the price this was a highlight of our four city tour of Italy. The day and night staff were very good and arranged to get us all to the airport and were always helpful. Rooms were rather a good size for a two star hotel. Price was low but our stay was most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A good value near Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights in November. We had checked out of the nearby Hotel Cervia Roma because it was terrible. The Hotel Stella is very close to Termini Station (<5 minutes walking). The staff was very friendly (Paul was very helpful -- helped us find laundromat, got transportation information, and restaurant recommendations). The heating worked well, and we didn't notice any noise, but we had stayed out late at the bar next door (Julius Ceasar). My favorite part was that we paid 55EURO for our double room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Cozy BUT...Just Ignore the Front Desk Guy”
Reviews.Author: kar1969
Reviews.Content: Wow, based on some reviews below, it's amazing the different perspectives people have on this place. I decided to give the Stella a try for my 4-night mid-Nov. stay through a very good European hotel website. And, to even my surprise, I was 100% satisfied. True, the street in front of Termini is rather seedy with Gypsy panhandlers and the like, but once you walk a mere two blocks toward the hotel the area improves greatly --thus, no problem since I've easily been through much scarier areas in large American cities. This paled in comparison. Upon arriving at the hotel, I was met by a SEEMINGLY nice desk person (more on this strange dude, below) who I asked to assign me a room above the 2nd floor due to the allegedly "loud" bar on the ground level. He gladly gave me the key to a perfectly immaculate single room (queen size bed) on the 5th floor which was identical to the photos on the website. If anything, my room, 509, often was a little too warm, but the water pressure and hotness of the bathroom & shower water were fantastic. The linens were crispy and white, the bed sufficiently comfortable, floor perfectly vacuumed, and the only noises from the street were the constant motor scooters ubiquitous in Rome. Cleanliness, simplicity, and a funcional private bathroom are really all I require in foreign hotels, especially at a rate of only 50 euros. However, my stay at the Stella was slightly tarnished because of my experience during check out: I had a 6:30am flight and needed to check out by 4 am, which, for some reason, made the same "nice" desk guy (above) go absolutely ballistic. He huffed and puffed and rolled his eyes as he threw the ink pen at me and gruffingly growled "that'll be 200 euros, and why do you check out this early and disturb our guests this morning?!" I explained about my early flight, but informed him that it shouldn't matter anyway, because this was a part of his job. Upon my trying to sign the credit card receipt, the inkpen that was thrown at me wasn't working. I turned the receipt over and started scribbling to get the ink flowing. Boy, that REALLY sent him in a rage as he shouted, "what are you doing!...what's wrong with you!!...this is an important document!...you make me wake up right now to play games...what's the matter with you?!" After a few more "kind" words, I left with my credit card, the receipt, my luggage, and a casual giggle over how much of a basket case this guy really is. Since I had no problems with any of the other staff, and since my particular room was perfectly clean, quiet and comfortable, I'll eagerly stay there again. ...Just remember to avoid the rude, crazy guy.

Reviews.Title: “i agree...never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: bell51
Reviews.Content: my son and i arrived for a 4 day break this week in rome, and booked the hotel stella, as it was said to be near the terminus, well it was, but nobody mentioned the 10 minute walk through the seediest area i've seen in a long time!, full of sleeping vagrants and drunks. we were greeted by the hotel staff, who had not been trained in customer relations! I would'nt say they were rude exactly, but there was no interest in us at all. on being shown to our room on the third floor, we found it to be basic, but clean. after a day out seeing the sights, we wanted to relax in our room until it was time to eat, but it was SO cold that we went straight back out again, mentioning that the radiator was not working, and asking them to fix it,...for two days we put up with the cold after again mentioning it to the rather unhelpful night person, who insisted it was not working because i had turned it off!!...absolutely not true, i tried to get it too work by turning it BOTH ways...to no avail. on the third day we returned to the hotel to be told our room had been changed and all our belongings had been packed up and moved to a room on the first floor...i would have preferred to pack up our OWN things and i found this totally unacceptable, but we were pleased to be moved to a warmer room. having said that, it contained one double bed, and a single, which was as hard as iron!!and overlooked the central courtyard, where our only 'veiw' was a generator, dustbins and old mattresses!! The breakfast was very basic, but it did see you through to lunch. i would definately NOT stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i just recently returned from a four day break whilst staying only three nights in the so called hotel stella. we arrived to find two single camp beds pushed together to make a double in a basic,musty room. the female reception staff were very rude and as if it was too much trouble for them to lend me a hairdryer. when we asked for help about our taxi to the airport we were answered with 'i dont know' with no attempt whatsoever to help us any further. breakfast very meagre.we left a day early having had enough of the hard beds and bad attitudes and stayed in a different hotel costing extra but worth every euro.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights. When we arrived after a tiring trip, a very unkind, rude man was sitting behind the reception. He wanted to get rid of us although we had booked in advance. After being threaded as intruders, we got the key of our room. Other girls working there were all nice and friendly. Good location, not far from Termini and also easy to go by foot to the center of Rome. Room and bathroom clean and neat. There was a fridge in the room but it was not working. Also a safe available. Breakfast very sober. Big disadvantage, there is bar/discotheque at streetlevel. So very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “a small but acceptable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in June 2005,the hotel rooms are small but comfortable ,adequate facilities,with a safe in the bedroom (free to use)for your valuables,very clean.breakfast room is small (seats about 20)and choice of food not extensive.The hotel staff were pleasant and efficient. The main advantage of this hotel is its position in respect of transport, 5 mins walk from the Termini railway station, bus station and Metro lines, giving easy access to the main tourist sites,.No bar in the hotel , but The Julius Ceaser bar is next door, also a good restaurant is just across the street, I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very --- noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: Bibulle_be
Reviews.Content: We have been there in february! I knew ther was a discotec on the "rez de chaussée"/ that's why I had mentionned in my booking via email for a quiet room, as high as possible... The manager assured that it would be a quiet room! When we arrived we've received a room on the 2nd floor (the 1st floor was in renovation) just above the discotec. Music until very late, more than 2 o'clock and at 7 o'clock they began to work on the first floor wich very very noisy machines... I forgot the airco that started in the middle of the night!!! The laidies at the reception were not so helpfull.. One never smiled to us! But the guys at night were beter! It was just good because not far from the station and "cheap" (for Rome), but if I go back there I take another hotel! Sure!!! En concluion: si vous supportez le bruit, ça va, mais aussi non, selon mon expérience personnelle, c'est pas génial!

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: markgparker
Reviews.Content: We have some good points and bad point on this hotel; we stayed for 3 nights in February 05. We will start with the good point, Hotel and room very clean, staff helpful and cheap to stay only £48 per night per room. The not so bad point, no English TV channel you can only watch so much of MTV in Italian but this you can put up with. Bad point, can be very noisy, the hotel has no double glazing just a shutter and single glass which doesn’t shut right up, I would suggest getting tied before going to bed. One point on booking via Expedia, we booked for 2 people and this is shown on my booking form but on arrival Expedia had booked only one person in, but this was no problem for the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ToscaCheng
Reviews.Content: I spend 5 stays in 9/8~12, and I have fine stays. The hotel is easy to find, and not far from the Termini Station. The new decoration of the room, makes us relax and comfortable. We are satisfied with the facilities: Cable TV, Twin Bed, Phone, and very very clean and brand new bathroom. The ladies on the count treat us very nicely, always with smile. The breakfast is the buffet with cookies, jams, crossiants, and american style coffe. Not such many , but enought to feed us. It's a pity that we can't get the cappuccino, but the atmosphere in the dining room is OK. It's not hot is the September, so we didn't pay 7 euros per day for the air-conditioner, but we let the window stay opened while we are sleeping- and , the noise from the bar downstairs is a little harsh to us in the midnight. But it's ok, since you may spend all your energy to walk in Roma, you can fall in deep sleep quickly. It's such a beautilful when we open the window, to look the big tree and the walls, make us relax. In all, in the very reasonable price, you can just pick this Hotel, and you don't need to worry about what you will get. It's just a fine hotel. We get the room and it's above our expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Basic base”
Reviews.Author: SurreyEngland
Reviews.Content: Very handy for Termini station, metro, buses. Room clean, adequate, but wouldn't want to spend much time there. Could do with an English-language channel on the TV. Breakfast very basic, coffee, bread, jam, cheese. 100 euros a night seems expensive for what you get but that's Rome for you. Large supermarket a few doors away is very useful. Can get a bit noisy late at night from the local bars. Overall, great as a base if you are out all day sightseeing, but nothing memorable.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Location, clean, nice and helpful people, poor breakfast, overall good value given the prices in Rome - last summer 75 euro this summer 95 - not worth the increase in price

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: kingleo
Reviews.Content: The rooms were large and airy and we had no problems at all. The bathroom was new and very clean. The location was great, only five minutes walk from Termini where the airport link bus stops. Everywhere in Rome is easy to get to on foot from this hotel although there are not that many great restaurants in the immediate area. We travelled over the busy Easter weekend and still managed to pay less than £100 each for three nights B & B. I would return again on my next trip to Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Stella
HotelInfo.Address: Via Castelfidardo, 51, 00185 Rome, Italy
